comments.html: If they (M$) use 00 for hardware type all would be OK. They simply mixed the two paragraphs.
comments.name: Anonymous

comments.html:
Here is a handy snip from the config file form most of my dhcp server (ISC's dhcpd daemon).

#
# Don't give NT RAS servers IP addresses
# (their use is unauthorised)
if substring (option dhcp-client-identifier, 0, 4) = "RAS " {
deny booting;
}
#
comments.name: Anonymous

comments.html:
The ILOM ports of Cisco UCS servers use client identifiers like "Cisco Systems Inc|+|R210-2121605W|+|QCI161xxxxx"

(where the last field is a serial number)
comments.name: Unknown
